com.chrismin13.additionsapi.items

Class CustomArmor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.chrismin13.additionsapi.items.CustomItem
      • com.chrismin13.additionsapi.items.CustomArmor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<CustomItem>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CustomLeatherArmor, CustomTexturedArmor

    public class CustomArmor
extends CustomItem
    Creates a Custom Item with the ItemType ARMOR and the ArmorDurability Durability Mechanics.
    Author:
    chrismin13

    • Constructor Detail

      • CustomArmor

        public CustomArmor(org.bukkit.Material material,
                   int amount,
                   short durability,
                   java.lang.String idName)
        Creates a Custom Armor Piece.
        Parameters:
        material - The Material that the Custom Armor will be made of. Valid Materials are all that contain in their name HELMET, CHESTPLATE, LEGGINGS or BOOTS.
        amount - The amount of the Custom Armor. Recommended value is one, as Armor Pieces do not have a stackable size higher than 1 by default.
        durability - The Durability of the Custom Armor.
        idName - the Custom Armor's ID Name. This MUST BE SIMILAR to "vanilla_additions:emerald_sword" and is saved in the ItemStack so you can easily detect which Custom Armor it is.

    • Method Detail

      • getArmorType

        public ArmorType getArmorType()
        Returns:
        The ArmorType of the CustomTool. This is found using the ArmorType.getArmorType(Material) method, where material is the Custom Armor's Material.

      • addAttribute

        public CustomArmor addAttribute(Attributes.AttributeType type,
                                double amount,
                                Attributes.Operation operation)
        Adds an Attribute to the CustomItem. If you don't know what they do or how they work, check out the Minecraft wiki. The UUID will be the one that is found by default in Minecraft for the specified Slot. The name will be, as a placeholder, TBD (which means To Be Determined).
        The EquipmentSlot will be automatically added by checking the Armor Type of the Material of the Custom Armor.
        Parameters:
        type - The attribute that will be added.
        amount - The amount of the attribute. Can also be a negative value.
        operation - The math operation that will be used for the amount specified.

      • getDurabilityMechanics

        public ArmorDurability getDurabilityMechanics()
        Overrides:
        getDurabilityMechanics in class CustomItem
        Returns:
        ArmorDurability - The ItemDurability mechanics. These determine how the durability of the CustomArmor, both for Fake and real durability, will drop.

      • setDurabilityMechanics

        @Deprecated
public CustomItem setDurabilityMechanics(ItemDurability itemDurability)

        These determine how the durability of the CustomArmor, both for Fake and real durability, will drop.
        Overrides:
        setDurabilityMechanics in class CustomItem
        Parameters:
        itemDurability - the itemDurability to set. Every class that extends or is ArmorDurability is valid.
        Returns:

      • setDurabilityMechanics

        public CustomArmor setDurabilityMechanics(ArmorDurability armorDurability)
        These determine how the durability of the CustomArmor, both for Fake and real durability, will drop.
        Parameters:
        armorDurability - the armorDurbility to set. Every class that extends or is ArmorDurability is valid.

      • addArmor

        public CustomArmor addArmor(double amount)
        Adds the Attributes.AttributeType Armor with the amount specified using the addition operation.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of armor to be added.

      • addArmorToughness

        public CustomArmor addArmorToughness(double amount)
        Adds the Attributes.AttributeType Armor Toughness with the amount specified using the addition operation. The Armor Toughness Attribute was added in 1.9.1, so, just like this plugin, it won't work on earlier versions of Minecraft. I haven't tested this feature on those old versions!
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of armor to be added.
